summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from 2019 between prosecutors in the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, requesting and obtaining travel approval for the team investigating Jeffrey Epstein (case 2018R01618). The emails detail planned trips to Los Angeles and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale to conduct victim interviews and meetings.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: Recipient of multiple travel approval requests from the prosecution team; grants approval for travel related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: Copied on travel approval requests; part of the prosecution team for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on several travel approval requests; part of the prosecution team for the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the investigation referenced as 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity.

keyFacts: The document reveals active investigation by the SDNY into Jeffrey Epstein in 2019 under case number 2018R01618, described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
The prosecution team made multiple trips to Los Angeles and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale, Florida, specifically to conduct victim interviews, indicating these were key locations for witnesses.
Travel requests often included booking a conference room at a hotel to conduct the interviews, suggesting formal, recorded proceedings.
The emails show a pattern of internal bureaucratic approval (from Edward Tyrrell) required for investigative travel, highlighting the official nature of the probe.
Several email addresses and names of other potential team members are redacted (shown as '>'), indicating the involvement of additional personnel not publicly named.
